name: ROOCSS
body: ### Welcome to ROOCSS : Rich Object Oriented CSS Pages. ROOCSS make it easier to build stylesheet for medium and large projects. It was build with the intent to improve the development of website on a ruby on rails environment but it can be applied to any type of web language or framework. ### Guideline: An Introduction to Rich Object Oriented CSS (ROOCSS) * Separation of structure from skin * Separation of containers and content * Grid set the width and Content set the height * CSS with the suffix "_debug" define the look ``` Assets - Images/ - Javascripts/ - Stylesheets/ -- Fonts/ -- Library.css -- Layout.css -- Grid.css -- Content.css -- Content_debug.css (HTML in the root) ``` If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch. ### Files Structure: ### Template: Play with our template in Firebug to learn the basics of ROOCSS ### The Benefits Of OOCSS - performance - smaller file size - maintainable stylesheets ### FAQ - Where ROOCSS come from? ROOCSS was inspired by OOCSS created by Nicole Sullivan (https://github.com/stubbornella/). If you have any question about the OOCSS part of ROOCSS just visit https://github.com/stubbornella/oocss/wiki/faq - How is ROOCSS different from OOCSS? ROOCSS was designed to fit my need as a Ruby on Rails Developer. - Can I remove unused styles? Totally. If you are done building you're website and you don't need some element feel free to remove them. ### Authors and Contributors You can contact the author @richardsondx on Twitter. ### Support or Contact Having trouble with ROOCSS? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact richardsondx@gmail.com and Iâ€™ll help you sort it out.
